sep.gaia.resources.poi

Class POICategory

  • java.lang.Object
    • sep.gaia.resources.poi.POICategory

  • public class POICategory
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a major-category for point-of-interests. Each category has its own mnemonic name, conditions to be met by POIs to be part of it, as well as sub-categories containing the POIs themselves. If a category has the activated flag set, its POIManager will take it in consideration when loading new POIs and when passing newly available resources to its observers.
    Author:
    Max Witzelsperger (Specification: Matthias Fisch)

    • Constructor Detail

      • POICategory

        public POICategory(java.lang.String name,
           java.util.Collection<SubCategory> subcategories,
           boolean enabled,
           POIFilter filter)
        Initializes a major-category for POIs.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the category.
        subcategories - Collection of sub-categories of this category. They can be used for specifying stronger criteria to be met.
        enabled - Flag wether the category is activated. If a category has the actived flag set, its POIManager will take it in consideration when loading new POIs and when passing newly available resources to its observers.
        filter - The conditions a POI must fulfill to be part of the category.

    • Method Detail

      • isActivated

        public boolean isActivated()
        Returns if the category and its sub-categories are activated. If a category has the actived flag set, its POIManager will take it in consideration when loading new POIs and when passing newly available resources to its observers.
        Returns:
        true if the category is activated. Otherwise false is returned.

      • activate

        public void activate(boolean active)
        Sets if the major-category and its sub-categories are activated. If a category has the actived flag set, its POIManager will take it in consideration when loading new POIs and when passing newly available resources to its observers.
        Parameters:
        active - true if the category should be activated. Otherwise false is returned.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Getter of the category name
        Returns:
        the name of the category

      • getSubcategories

        public java.util.Collection<SubCategory> getSubcategories()
        Returns a collection of all sub-categories of this category. The limitations of the major-category are included in those in a subcategory.
        Returns:
        A collection of all sub-categories.

      • setSubcategories

        public void setSubcategories(java.util.Collection<SubCategory> subcategories)
        Sets the collection of all sub-categories. Entries in subcategories must not contain the limitations of this major-category in their limitation-set.
        Parameters:
        subcategories - Collection of all sub-categories
